intro: Niederleinia chubutensis, commonly known as the Chubut lichen, is a foliose lichen that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. It belongs to the family Parmeliaceae and is characterized by its leathery, crust-like thallus with a distinct, often bright green to yellowish upper surface. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a photosynthetic partner, typically a green alga, and a fungal partner from the Ascomycota division. It is endemic to the Patagonian region of Argentina, where it grows on rock surfaces and soil. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
